company.name: Reynolds Consumer Products Inc.
company.address: 1900 West Field Court, Lake Forest, Illinois 60045
company.business_description: Reynolds manufactures and sells food wrapping foil and a variety of other household products for cooking, storage, and disposal.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

complaint.factual_background: Reynolds Consumer Products Inc. self-certified to the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework in April 2009 for both customer data and human resources data. However, the company failed to renew its certification in April 2010 (for customer data) and April 2011 (for HR data), causing its status to become 'not current.' Despite this, Reynolds continued to represent on its website from 2009 until November 2013 that it complied with the Safe Harbor Framework, thereby making false claims about its participation in the privacy framework.

representations_made.description: Claimed its Privacy Policy complies with the Safe Harbor Principles regarding the processing of Personal Data transferred from the European Economic Area to the United States
representations_made.quoted_text: Due to the global nature of Reynolds’ business, transfers of Personal Data across national boundaries may occur. As a result, this Privacy Policy complies with the Safe Harbor Principles as agreed upon by the United States Department of Commerce and the European Commission regarding the collection, use, processing, disclosure, transfer and retention (collectively “Processing”) of Personal Data with respect to Personal Data transferred from the European Economic Area (EEA) to the United States.

representations_made.description: Represented that it was a current participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework
representations_made.quoted_text: 14. Through the means described in Paragraph 13, respondent represented, expressly or by implication, that it was a “current” participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework.

counts.title: False Safe Harbor Certification Claims
counts.representation: Respondent represented that it was a 'current' participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework
counts.fact: From April 2010 until November 2013, respondent was not a 'current' participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework with respect to the customer data it handles. Further, from April 2011 until November 2013, respondent was not a 'current' participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework with respect to the human resources data it handles
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representation set forth in Paragraph 14 is false and misleading.

definitions.respondent: Reynolds Consumer Products Inc. and its successors and assigns.
definitions.Commerce: as defined in Section 4 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 44.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy or Security Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent its membership in, adherence to, compliance with, certification by, endorsement by, or participation in any privacy or security program sponsored by the government or self-regulatory organizations, including Safe Harbor Frameworks.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent extent of membership, adherence, compliance, certification, endorsement, or participation in any privacy or security program sponsored by government or self-regulatory organizations, including U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework and U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Framework
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that respondent and its officers, agents, representatives, and employees, whether acting directly or indirectly, in connection with the advertising, marketing, promotion, offering for sale, or sale of any product or service, in or affecting commerce, shall not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by the government or any other self-regulatory or standard-setting organization, including, but not limited to, the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework and the U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Framework.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC all documents relating to compliance with the order for five years from the date of preparation or dissemination.

requirements.description: Maintain and make available for inspection all advertisements, promotional materials, and statements containing representations covered by the order, with all materials relied upon in disseminating the representation
requirements.quoted_text: A. all advertisements, promotional materials, and any other statements containing any representations covered by this order, with all materials relied upon in disseminating the representation; and

requirements.description: Maintain and make available for inspection any documents that call into question respondent's compliance with the order
requirements.quoted_text: B. any documents, whether prepared by or on behalf of respondent, that call into question respondent’s compliance with this order.

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of the order to all current and future personnel with responsibilities relating to the subject matter and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.

requirements.description: Deliver copy of order to all current principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives having responsibilities relating to the subject matter
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, and managers, and to all current and future employees, agents, and representatives having responsibilities relating to the subject matter of this order. Respondent shall deliver this order to such current personnel within thirty (30) days

requirements.description: Deliver order to future personnel with relevant responsibilities
requirements.quoted_text: after service of this order, and to such future personnel within thirty (30) days after the person assumes such position or responsibilities. For any business entity resulting from any change in

requirements.description: For any business entity resulting from change in structure, deliver order prior to the change
requirements.quoted_text: assumes such position or responsibilities. For any business entity resulting from any change in structure set forth in Part IV, delivery shall be at least ten (10) days prior to the change in structure. Respondent must secure a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of this

requirements.description: Secure signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of order from all persons receiving a copy
requirements.quoted_text: structure. Respondent must secure a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of this order, within thirty (30) days of delivery, from all persons receiving a copy of the order pursuant to this section.

provisions.title: Corporate Change Notification
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the Commission at least 30 days prior to any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, merger, bankruptcy, or name changes.

requirements.description: Notify Commission at least 30 days prior to any corporate change affecting compliance obligations (dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, successor corporation, subsidiary creation/dissolution, bankruptcy filing, or name/address change)
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall notify the Commission at least thirty (30) days prior to any change in the corporation(s) that may affect compliance obligations arising under this order, including, but not limited to: a dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, or other action that would result in the emergence of a successor corporation; the creation or dissolution of a subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this order; the proposed filing of a bankruptcy petition; or a change in the corporate name or address.

requirements.description: If learning of proposed change fewer than 30 days prior, notify Commission as soon as practicable after obtaining such knowledge
requirements.quoted_text: Provided, however, that, with respect to any proposed change in the corporation(s) about which respondent learns fewer than thirty (30) days prior to the date such action is to take place, respondent shall notify the Commission as soon as is practicable after obtaining such knowledge.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a compliance report with the Commission within 60 days after service of the order and submit additional reports upon request within 10 days.

requirements.description: File with Commission a true and accurate report setting forth in detail the manner and form of compliance with the order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent, and its successors and assigns, within sixty (60) days after the date of service of this order, shall file with the Commission a true and accurate report, in writing, setting forth in detail the manner and form of its compliance with this order. Within ten (10) days of receipt of written notice from a representative of the Commission,

requirements.description: Submit additional true and accurate written report upon receipt of written notice from Commission representative
requirements.quoted_text: order. Within ten (10) days of receipt of written notice from a representative of the Commission, it shall submit an additional true and accurate written report.

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: The order will terminate on June 19, 2034, or 20 years from the most recent date the United States or Commission files a complaint in federal court alleging violation of the order, whichever comes later.

requirements.description: Order remains in effect until termination date, which is June 19, 2034, or 20 years from most recent complaint filing date, whichever is later
requirements.quoted_text: This order will terminate on June 19, 2034, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of:

duration.termination_text: This order will terminate on June 19, 2034, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later
